user_message:
An agent A claimed that the following lfs_file_write code violates the MISRA C 2023 rule 14.3.
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<target_code>
Here is the original code of lfs_file_write.
```c
lfs_ssize_t lfs_file_write(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_file_t *file,
        const void *buffer, lfs_size_t size) {
    int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }
    LFS_TRACE("lfs_file_write(%p, %p, %p, %"PRIu32")",
            (void*)lfs, (void*)file, buffer, size);
    LFS_ASSERT(lfs_mlist_isopen(lfs->mlist, (struct lfs_mlist*)file));

    lfs_ssize_t res = lfs_file_write_(lfs, file, buffer, size);

    LFS_TRACE("lfs_file_write -> %"PRId32, res);
    LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg);
    return res;
}
```
</target_code>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- explanation: your evaluation of the scenario provided by the agent A.
- is_report_correct: whether the report is correct or not (true/false). True means there is a violation.
</response format>
<scenario>
The agent A provided the following violation scenario:
The macro LFS_LOCK(cfg) expands to ((void)cfg, 0), so int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg) always yields 0. Consequently the controlling expression if (err) in lfs_file_write is invariant (always false), which violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3. The provided exceptions (infinite loops or do-while false constant) do not apply to this if-statement.
</scenario>

<execution_log>
The agent A also provided the following output log:

<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function lfs_file_write:
#define LFS_LOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg,0)
...
#define LFS_UNLOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg)
...
#define LFS_ASSERT(test) assert(test)
...
#define LFS_TRACE(__VA_ARGS__) 
...
static bool lfs_mlist_isopen(struct lfs_mlist *head,
        struct lfs_mlist *node) {
    for (struct lfs_mlist **p = &head; *p; p = &(*p)->next) {
        if (*p == (struct lfs_mlist*)node) {
            return true;
        }
    }

    return false;
}
...
#define LFS_UNLOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg)
</additional code>

<instruction>
Judge whether the report is correct or not.
</instruction>
explanation: Agent A is correct. In the shown configuration LFS_LOCK(cfg) expands to ((void)cfg, 0), so int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg) is always assigned the constant value 0 and the controlling expression if (err) is therefore invariant (always false). MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 disallows invariant controlling expressions except for the two listed exceptions (infinite loops or the specific do-while constant-false case), neither of which applies to this if statement. The execution log also shows err is always 0. (If the macro can be conditionally redefined to a non-constant implementation in other build configurations, then the rule would need to be assessed per-configuration; for the provided code/configuration the report is a true violation.)
